com.bmd.jrt.android.invocator

Interface RoutineInvocator


  • public interface RoutineInvocator
    Interface defining an helper class used to invoke routines linked to a context lifecycle.

    Routine invocations started through the implementing classes can be safely restored after a change in the configuration, so to avoid duplicated calls and memory leaks.

    Note that the equals() and hashCode() methods of the input parameter objects might be employed to check for clashing of invocations or compute the invocation ID.
    In case the caller cannot guarantee the correct behavior of the aforementioned method implementations, a user defined ID or the RESET clash resolution should be used to avoid unexpected results.

    Created by davide on 12/9/14.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  RoutineInvocator.ClashResolution
      Invocation clash resolution enumeration.
      The clash of two invocation happens when the same ID is already in use at the time of the routine execution.
      static class  RoutineInvocator.ResultCache
      Result cache type enumeration.
      The cache type indicates what will happen to the result of an invocation after its completion.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int GENERATED_ID
      Constant identifying a routine ID computed from the executor class and the input parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        @Nonnull
<INPUT,OUTPUT> ParameterChannel<INPUT,OUTPUT> invoke(@Nonnull
                                                           ClassToken<? extends Invocation<INPUT,OUTPUT>> classToken)
        Invokes the routine employing the specified executor.
        Type Parameters:
        INPUT - the input data type.
        OUTPUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        classToken - the invocation class token.
        Returns:
        the routine parameter channel.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified token is null.

      • onClash

        @Nonnull
RoutineInvocator onClash(@Nonnull
                               RoutineInvocator.ClashResolution resolution)
        Tells the invocator how to resolve clashes of invocation inputs. A clash happens when an invocation of the same type and with the same ID is still running.
        Parameters:
        resolution - the type of resolution.
        Returns:
        this invocator.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified resolution type is null.

      • onComplete

        @Nonnull
RoutineInvocator onComplete(@Nonnull
                                  RoutineInvocator.ResultCache cacheType)
        Tells the invocator how to cache the invocation result after its completion.
        Parameters:
        cacheType - the cache type.
        Returns:
        this invocator.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified cache type is null.

      • withId

        @Nonnull
RoutineInvocator withId(int id)
        Tells the invocator to identify the invocation with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the invocation ID.
        Returns:
        this invocator.
